people

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • thebase.HumanBeeing
      • people.Player

  • public class Player
extends thebase.HumanBeeing
    This class creates the characters that the player can use. It also generates an Inventory that all characters can use.
    Author:
    Batuhan Avci

      This Constructor generates a player controlled character with start values.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Player

        public Player(java.lang.String Name,
              int baseHP,
              int baseArmor,
              int baseDmg,
              int XP,
              int money,
              boolean playablechar,
              int mana)
        This Constructor generates a player controlled character with start values.
        Parameters:
        Name - The name of the character
        baseHP - the base healthpoints that the player has at the start.
        baseArmor - The base armor that the character has at the start.
        baseDmg - the base damage that the character has at the start.
        XP - the amount of xp that the Character gets at the start of it's creation.
        money - the amount of money that all the character get has at the start.
        playablechar - checks if the character is controlable by the player.
        mana - the amount of mana the character has at the start.

      • inventoryOutPut

        public void inventoryOutPut(Player player)
        This method let's the player enter his Inventory. Let's him choose what exactly he wan'ts to equip.
        Parameters:
        player - the player that is currently in the inventory and is getting equipped.

      • getArmorWithEquip

        public int getArmorWithEquip(Player player)
        This Method calculates the total armor of one character.
        Parameters:
        player - The player that should be checked.
        Returns:
        Returns the total amount of defense that this character has.

        Parameters:
        potion - Asks for the bought potion.
        buy - Checks if the potion if fresh bought or not.
        transferAmount - the amount of potions that are added the the inventory.

                       boolean buy,
                       int transferAmount)
        Let's the player equip a Chest.
        Parameters:
        chest - the chest object that is getting equipped.
        player - the character that is getting the chest equipped.
        buy - checks if the chest was bought or not
        transferAmount - the amount that was bought or equipped.
